page.title: 17FARMING SOUTH OF SALISBURY
page.content: Farms in the area specialise in arable and livestock. Beef production and dairying are important. Some fields are used for arable whilst others are used for permanent and temporary grazing. Lucerne is grown for cattle feed. Bridge Farm at Britford specialises in beef_farming. It also produces wheat, winter_barley, spring_barley, and oats. It is worked by 5 men with 3 tractors. The River Avon is an important source of water for its livestock. The level of the water has to be carefully watched as it varies greatly in summer. There are problems of access across the main Salisbury to Bournemouth road as well as stock_worrying and vandalism by dogs and people from nearby housing.
